      • determineMove

        public java.util.List<Move> determineMove(Board b,
                                 java.util.List<Tile> hand)
        Dumb startegy for determining a move First we get all of the empty spots, visible on the board Then we go through our tiles, point by point, and ask if it is a valid move. Ifso we do that move, if not we continue with the points/tiles
        Specified by:
        determineMove in interface Strategy
        Parameters:
        b - the playing board
        Returns:
        the best move set, null if we need to trade

      • determineTrade

        public java.util.List<Tile> determineTrade(java.util.List<Tile> hand)
        Dumb strategy for trading: We first get a random number for how many tiles we need to trade. Then we will get `x` random tiles, and trade those.
        Specified by:
        determineTrade in interface Strategy
        Parameters:
        hand - the List of Tiles which make up the players hand
        Returns:
        a List of Tiles to trade
